metadata.title: CVE-2019-11811 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.4. There is ause-after-free upon attempted read access to /proc/ioports after theipmi_si module is removed, related to drivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_intf.c,drivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_mem_io.c, anddrivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_port_io.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1077.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-23-lowlatency - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1030-gke - 4.15.0-1030.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1011-gke - 5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1014-azure - 5.0.0-1014.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
No subscription required
